page.title: 15PENN WOODS
page.content: Mr Tithecott came to talk to us about Penn woods.He is Lord Howe's forester and the father of Sam, who is in our class.You have to have 3 years practical forestry and then take an exam which includes biology and entomology to be a forester. Most of the trees in Penn Woods are beech trees for the furniture trade.If beech is growing on chalky soil the wood inside will be white,if it is grown on clay it will be yellow. Beech trees take about 120 years to mature, but conifers mature in 40-60 years so quite a few are now being planted(the ratio is 1/3 hardwood, 2/3 softwood). The softwoods planted here are western hemlock,sica spruce,contorta pine, Douglas fir and western red cedar. The muntjac deer in these woods aren't a problem to saplings but grey squirrels are.
